channel.title: june on The long way through Software Craftsmanship
channel.description: Recent content in june on The long way through Software Craftsmanship

item.title: Self-Study in June 2024
item.description: Scientific glassblower continues century-old campus tradition (2021) the story of a glassblower dedicated to producing specialized hardware for a university https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=40549209 Tags: hackernews, imported, dredmorbius, glassblower, university, hardware, profession, glass Id: e07b0ed2-185b-4cf7-bdbe-a134c555d797 Read: Sat, 01 Jun 2024 21:26:29 +0000 Half a century of SQL https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=40561440 Tags: hackernews, imported, pseudolus, sql, programming-language, anniversary, birthday Id: f971c65c-8034-47c1-b2f5-24358c2de7b4 Read: Mon, 03 Jun 2024 11:04:06 +0000 Entropy, a CLI that scans files to find high entropy lines (might be secrets) https://news.

item.title: Self-Study in June 2019
item.description: (h0p3’s Wiki) This is a highly customized tiddlyWiki, from h0p3. Tags: wiki, personal-knowledge-base, h0p3 Id: b8b3d973-9611-4180-854a-0242ac110003 Read: Fri, 7 Jun 2019 13:20:26 +0000 Debug bash scripts This article explains how to debug bash scripts using the DEBUG trap. Declares several log levels for the commands Tags: debug, bash, trap, help, script Id: 39f76af4-99ce-48b6-adc1-0242ac110003 Read: Fri, 7 Jun 2019 13:20:26 +0000 Understanding Rust Lifetimes Describes rust lifetimes, lifetime parameters. Compares them to C++ pointers (in the sense they are difficult to learn, but make things explicit).

item.title: Self-Study in June 2018
item.description: Don’t look, don’t tell I’ve read this bonilista by David Bonilla on what strategies companies use to deal with security and defects. Explains full disclosure, responsible disclosure and bug bounties. Tags: david-bonilla, bonilista, security, full-disclosure, responsible-disclosure, bug-bounty, reporting, hacker, cracker Id: a1a6925a-7958-11e8-a87f-0242ac110002 Read: Tue, 26 Jun 2018 15:50:21 +0000 La vida de las ideas I’ve read this bonilista by David Bonilla about the value of the ideas and what differentiates a good idea from a good execution from a good outcome

item.title: Self-Study in June 2017
item.description: So Hey You Should Stop Using Texts for Two-Factor Authentication I’ve read this article explaining why messages over SMS should not be used for the ‘what you own’ in 2FA. Tags: andy-greenberg, 2fa, sms, security, warning Why I’d never work for Google, Twitter, or Facebook I’ve read this article by David Bryant Copeland on why he would never work for these three companies: he doesn’t share the principles and values from these companies.

item.title: Self-Study in June 2016
item.description: DiversityMediocrityIllusion I’ve read this article by Martin Fowler (on his bliki) about the diversity in conferences and the profession. How it is our job to incentive a positive feedback cycle that brings more diverse people into the workforce. Explains how they do it in ThoughtWorks and how they have changed in the last decade. Tags: martin-fowler, diversity, gender, workforce, conference, profession, bliki What do cryptic Github comments mean? I’ve read this article by Alex Beregszaszi on the abbreviations used in Github comments and pull requests.

item.title: Self-study in June 2015
item.description: Update: I’ve grouped all small posts related to the self-study from June 2015 into a single post Le monitoring de flux par l’exemple I’ve read this article about monitoring, in the way of “by example”, by Cédrick Lunven and Julien Kirch (French) The First Micro-service Architecture I’ve read this article about microservices and how they were implemented many years ago by Robert C. Martin How I Learned to Balance My Life With Remote Work I’ve read this article about balancing life and work, either physical or remote by Michael Erasmus
